29058632.review:
Among all the virtual novels I have played by far Steins;Gate has the most compelling story and characters. The plot centered around the many theories and possible realities of time travel is very well thought out and really brings out the best of all the other aspects of the game.

I'm not a fan of anime or big on my knowledge of japanese culture but this game does very well to accomodate any kind of player with its willingness to invest you in its interwovern world of facts and fiction which it does brilliantly I might add. The depth of the plot and characters belies it's cutesy art style and early game shenanigans as the development of both over its 30-40 hour length is quite staggering. It can quickly go from an experience akin to Malorie Blackmans novels to scenes that would make even Steven King shiver. (If you don't know these authors, go read a book idiot!) 

Truly, the writing is first class to be able to convey so much raw emotion in its high and low points and the music alongside this really did make the climatic moments even more hard hitting. Seriously, with the amount of low quality mindless rubbish that comes out of hollywood these days this VN deserves a movie adaptation and it would easily blow away the likes of Inception or Interstellar in it's complexity, application of time travel theory and actually having a decent cast of characters. (JK, Americans would just replace the meaningful humor with shouting and cast Jonah Hill (ugh) as Daru.) 

Getting back on topic, you owe it to yourself to play this game/read this novel. Guaranteed emotional destruction and the embracement of Nihilism which will set you up perfectly for Steins;Gate 0. 

10/10

29025510.review:
[h1] TL;DR [/h1]

[b] This VN is amazing. Truly beautiful. Crafted to perfection. Well written, well structured, well acted, well developed and well... amazing. 10/10. [/b]

[h1] Main Review [/h1]

I fell in love with this VN slowly, then all at once. 

I will begin by telling you how I dropped the anime. I hated it. It was slowly paced. I detested Okabe. I was confused. I was unfocused. I did not feel connected with the story or the characters. I just did not get the hype. 

A few months later, the VN was due to be released and as I was surrounded by the hype... I decided to give it another chance. I started reading the prolog and most of chapter 1 and dropped it again. I liked it more but I still wasn't feeling it. 

Skip another month on and I started again and read it within a week or so. Chapter 0-3 was interesting and a set up for what was due to come. I kept reading however still didn't understand the hype. I still felt the same way I felt as I watched the anime. Then chapter 4 happened and I was on the edge of my seat wanting more. Chapter 5 happened, and I was furiously hitting the keyboard to read the next line wanting to get through the story. Chapter 6 happened I stayed up until 6am reading it -  and the chapters thereafter.

Everything about this VN is perfect. That may be surprising for me to say that but now I understand. It is perfectly paced and everything is there for a reason. I grew on the characters, I felt everything they felt. The choices you make - through replies and emails sent or not - it matters to the overall story. Even the smallest thing can change the world as you know it... Every outcome that was good and bad was overwhelming with emotion, and honestly I lost count how many happy and sad tears were shed! 

I stated that I hated Okabe and I did not understand the gimmick he had forced upon the reader. Throughout the story you get little snippets of his true self and you realise how remarkable he truly is. The things he is thrown into and the choices he has to make are so selfless and he never does it halfheartedly. Each character is fleshed out perfectly (although I did want to see more of some but it wasn't needed). I felt like every character was perfectly symbolised in the story and fully developed. 

The music is incredible. Its just brilliant. It makes the reader feel every emotion in every scene and each song is memorable. I will definitely be adding each song to my playlist! The voice acting is amazing, even through I am an English speaker, I honestly felt every emotion and the tone was clearly presented in all the dialog. 

I fully recommend that you read all the endings that the VN provides as it really makes you appreciate all the characters more. Don't treat it as an ending to the story but as an alternative way to see a characters "true self" or backstory. I feel that this VN is perfect even if you have watched and enjoyed the anime because of this reason. As the anime shows the true ending, I feel like you are really missing out on the alternatives! 

This is honestly my favourite VN and I don't think anything can top it. I truly believe that. 10/10 

El. Psy. Kongroo~

28881313.review:
No quería escribir un análisis de Steins;Gate por que me convencí a mi mismo de que no podría hacerle justicia pero...Oh, qué diablos.

Nunca me ha gustado el término "Obra Maestra", o más bien, la connotación y la frecuencia con la que se utiliza. 
Pero sí es verdad que hay obras que sobresalen del común y hay otras que, solitarias, están en un nivel completamente distinto del resto.

Steins;Gate es una de estas últimas.

Al principio puede abrumar...lo...lenta que es. No me malinterpreten, me gustan las historias que se van cocinando a fuego lento pero después de un inicio bastante intenso, Steins;Gate cae en una especie de limbo espiral en el que ocurren cosas...Y a la vez no. O al menos, no podemos apreciar la importancia de los acontecimientos a corto plazo, si he de ser sincero esto casi me echa para atrás y de hecho la dejé aparcada por casi 2 meses.

Y entonces llegó el capítulo 5.

Oh joder el capítulo 5. A partir de ahí es todo un completo caos, pero en el mejor sentido de la palabra, la historia acaba por explotar y me voló la puta cabeza hasta el punto de tenerme pegado a la silla por horas sin poder dejar de leer y esto es algo que no me pasaba hace mucho con un videojuego.
 
No quiero hacer spoilers por que esta es una novela visual que HAY que jugar, independientemente de si eres o no un aficionado al género y tienes un buen nivel de inglés, pues tiene una historia  de viajes en el tiempo y de como pequeñas desiciones pueden provocar cambios impensables  en el presente excelentemente bien hilada, con personajes que brillan constantemente por sus diálogos y personalidades complejas, incluso aquellos que se presentan como clichés acaban mostrando su lado más humano y...al menos a mi me llegaron al kokoro.

Eso sí, preparate para mucha exposición sobre ciencia práctica y teórica, y procura tener el diccionario de inglés más hermoso que tengas por que es una novela visual bastante densa. 

PD: En términos de "jugabilidad", Steins;Gate se basa principalmente en un sistema bastante innovador de responder llamadas y mensajes de textos, recomiendo seguir una guía si quieres conseguir una ruta específica por que puede resultar un poco lioso.

28854432.review: The story of this game is absolutely amazing. You make choices that influence the story by deciding whether or not to answer/make a phone call, when/how to respond to emails, and whether or not to send a phone message. There are six different endings and many branching conversations/CGs that are only available when you make specific choices. I would recommend playing all the way through the game at least once before looking at any guides/spoilers. I also recommend saving at any points where you have to make a crucial decision (one choice results with a specific ending and the second choice moves on to the next chapter of the story) so you can reload to see the effects of each choice on the story. After seeing at least four different endings, I would recommend following a guide to see portions of the story that you missed, especially the CGs and true ending.

28853734.review:
Steins;Gate ist und bleibt eine der besten Visual Novels auf den westlichen Markt, auch wenn ich die VN bereits auf der PS Vita gelesen habe konnte ich mich nicht daran hindern sie mir noch einmal auf Steam zu holen.
Anspruchsvolle Story, viele vollkommen Verschiedene Endings und mit die emotionalsten Wendungen die man sich vorstellen kann. Auch wenn das "True" Ending für Visual Novel Neulinge ohne Walkthrough beinahe unmöglich zu erreichen ist so sind die restlichen 5 Endings ohne weitere Probleme und Vorwissen zu erreichen.
Die Soundtracks sind stets passend zur Situation und sehr Stimmig, klasse Synchronisation und Character entwicklung runden das ganze noch ab.
Bleibt somit nur noch auf den Steam release für Steins;Gate 0 zu warten.

[b]EL PSY CONGROO[/b]

类似薛定谔的猫的理论，强调观测，观测前所有可能是叠加的，观测后塌缩成唯一确定的现实）
+跌宕起伏、扣人心悬的剧情
+与动画相比更多细节与支线
（当然游戏才是原作，不过应该有不少玩家和我一样初见是动画，也算新奇的惊喜）

（由于有明确的主线支线之分，支线角色线结篇篇幅较短，故事逻辑依旧保持得很好，但精彩程度还是打折扣了）

是啊，从来没发生过，对他们如此重要的改变，如此珍贵的回忆，除了自己，再无人知晓
中二口吻能掩盖他的心虚，掩饰他的不安，但难掩他内心的温柔
独自承担所有责任，独自背负所有痛苦，一个孤独的观测者

无限可能的理论，无限可能的世界线
每个一见钟情背后都有一个动人的故事，或许是AB，或许是君名，亦或许是这样的[/spoiler]

[spoiler]终于
在这条世界线与你相遇。[/spoiler]

28703468.review:
It's currently 3am. I have been playing this for the past 14 or so hours, and I have never had such conflicting feelings about a game before. Minor spoilers follow. 

Well, game may be the wrong term. This is a visual novel. There's no gameplay beside the occasional interaction with your phone. And when I say occasional, maybe once every 45 minutes or so. You're going to be doing a lot of reading. Personally, I have no issue with this, although your mileage may vary. 

My biggest problem with this game is the protagonist, Okabe. He has a severe case of Chuunibyou. For those who don't know, he is a delusional, paranoid "mad scientist" who believes that "The Organization" is out to get him. He's prone to manaical laughter and over the top dramatics. He is one of the single most obnoxious, arrogant, bothersome, ridiculous, stupid MCs I've ever had the displeasure of experiencing. There were multiple times where I seriously considered quitting the game and moving onto something that didn't make me quickly skip through all of his dialouge. 

But then I hit the main turning point of the game. (You'll know it when you see it.) And that made me look at Okabe with completely fresh eyes. Somehow, I was tricked into empathizing with him, crying when he felt pain, and feeling triumphant when he experienced victory. I have no idea what happened.

So, now, I am sitting here, emotionally drained at 3 am. I haven't completed the story yet, although I have a feeling I'm about to head into the last act. And I also already know that I'm not going to do a second play through to see how much my changes actually affect the story. But ultimately, I have to recommend Steins;Gate. It took one of my most hated characters and turned him into someone who I genuinely want to succeed and find happiness. If you can stomach the first 10 or so hours, this turns into a really fantastic story about the soul, family, friends, and just how much someone is willing to give up in order to help them.

28418562.review:
This is hands-down the best time-travel story I have ever seen and quite possibly the best one I'll ever see in my life.

The story starts off leaving the player with quite a few questions and then proceeds to carry on with all of the characters just messing around and having fun with only only a little bit of foreshadowing hinting towards bad things to come, making the player THINK that this will be some kind of happy slice-of-life-y kind of thing... AND IT HAPPENS...

[REDACTED] HAPPENS... IT HAPPENS SO FAST THAT IT HITS YOU LIKE AN FTL-ENABLED TRAIN APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE FOREHEAD.

This game gets DARK, as in DARK AF. So if you can't handle the feels, then GTFO right now, but if you can then the only reasonable course of action is to immediately play this masterpiece of time-travel sci-fi. It's get so dark, that the main character, who at the beginning of the game is this funny and eccentric guy who pretends to be a mad scientist, has PTSD in the next game.

If you are of those people who, for whatever reason, can't or won't take the time to read through a whole VN, then watch the equally as good anime.

10/10 would feels again.

28245109.review:
This is amazing. Mindblowing. 

 I was a Steins;Gate maniac since i saw the the first anime episode and i really enjoyed it. It is actually in my personal top-3 list of the best anime of all time. I have re-watched it a number of times, so i practically know everything that happens there, like the in's and out's of the infinite time loop.

 So when i started to play this VN i was qute sure that it cant really surprise me, since i know the anime version of the story so well. Oh boy... i was soo naive.

 Let me start with the obvious fact that compared to the anime - here we have a lot more details even on the events that has been shown in the anime. Time travel theories explaind deeper, we have some additional lines, scenes, etc.  But the main attraction point is definetly the ability to reach scenes and endings that were never shown in the anime. And  the way the choices needed to reach the different world lines are made is so smart that it actually got me very confused.

 I was even going to comply that this game is not a visual novel at all, but just an interactive book. Because in the course of the game there were no standart "choose 1 of 3 actions" popups. The thing is that there ARE choices. But they are camouflaged and the game itself never teaches you about that - you have to figure is out for yourself. Now since i dont consider that as real spoiler i am going to say that aloud:  you make choices when you interact (or dont!) with your phone. Emails, calls, replys(or not!) - this all matters!  

 Honestly i didnt get it until i have finished up my first playthrough. I just interacted with the phone as i felt natural and in the end i have reached the Amane Suzuha ending. When the actual scenes started to divergence from the original canon anime i was really, really surprised, since i wasnt expecting that at all.  The feels hit like a truck. VERY COOL, SUNUVABICH!

 Now since i have figured it out i will go for the new playthrough, paying much more attention to what i do to the phone. Currently i am very excited to see what else the game has in store and which outcome will become the new choice of the Stains Gate. I am sorry if this review feels a bit scrambled, but i just had an urge to immidiately inform every original anime fan that this VN is a must buy thing, since it adds so much to the Gate world. 

 Also i strongly advice you to not read any guides on your first playthrough, and just see for yourself where you will end up. Let us meet again in the world of the Gates, comrades! EL PSY CONGROO!

100 out of 10.

28230158.review:
1.就算知道方法，也绝对不能去改变过去，绝不能将存在的可能性转变为既定的现实，未来是没有人能预测的，是无法重来的，正因如此人们才能接受各种痛苦，不幸与飞来横祸，迈步前进。
——冈部伦太郎《命运石之门》
2.未来的事情，谁也不知道。正因为如此，就如同再次相见本身，未来才有无限的可能——冈部伦太郎《命运石之门》
3.待在Lab里无所事事的时间，果汁入口的时候，走在街上的一瞬，在某时某刻与某人接吻的时候，就算不是时常也好，就算一百次中只有一次也好，希望你能够想起我，因为我就身在那里，在1%这个屏障的另一面，我也一定依然存在。——牧濑红莉栖《命运石之门》
4.时间飞快的流逝，唯独现在，我有一种想对爱因斯坦发牢骚的心情，冈部，时间根据每个人的主观感受，既会变长，也会变短，相对论真是既浪漫又伤感的东西呢。
——牧濑红莉栖《命运石之门》
5.“你以为只有自己一个人在支撑着这个世界吗？自以为是也要有个限度，不要忘记，不管你身处哪一条世界线，你都不会孤独。无论你身处何方，我都会找到你，我会一直观测着你，就像你一直以来观测着我一样。” ——牧濑红莉栖《命运石之门》
世界线变动率：1.048596% ,其实，冈部所做的一切，一切努力。最终都是为了到达这条名为命运石之门的世界线。成功反抗命运这事，压根就没成功过。感觉是神在他诞生时就写好的剧本。诡异的开篇（那个男性的惨叫声）,前几章漫长的铺垫，情感的酝酿，,后来通过Dmail不断的窜改过去，变更世界线。最后，又不得不一一回朔。最终回到原点，也就是故事的开端。然后，欺骗自己，欺骗世界。故事在此达到顶点。成功救回老婆，也成功救赎了自己。抵达了境界面上的命运石之门。——虽然我全篇看下来都是路人脸，不过这剧本给10分都不为过。
对你的爱，足以穿越世界线。无论任何时空，从此，你都不会再是孤身一人。

28062756.review:
[h1]Timeless.[/h1]
This marks the THIRD time (first time on Steam) that I've gone to play what has undoubtedly been my favorite visual novel of all time. Steins;Gate is a thought-provoking and heartbreaking show of consequences that come with f*cking with the laws of physics for self interest, starring a very human, chuuni protagonist along with a very likeable cast of characters. The title itself means [i]fate,[/i] as in no matter what you do nor how much time you undo, you cannot prevent what is ultimately destined to happen.

Very appealing artstyle, amazing voice acting (Mamoru Miyano especially), engaging and atmospheric soundtrack, great writing (props for the translation), and actually pretty informative. I love the fact that the staff calls us "lab members". A must-experience for VN readers and time-travel fans. [b]I stick by my VNDB score of 10/10.[/b]

A beautifully mesmerizing experience, unlike anything other I've experienced so far. 
Entertaining and thought-provoking to equal parts, this Visual Novel searches it's equals even outside of the game industry.

Story: 10/10 - Well crafted, intriguing and pensive story. Complex characters and overwhelming character development.
Graphics: 10/10 - Beautiful artworks, which makes you stop reading the story just to contemplate the drawings.
Sound: 9/10 - Memorable intro/outro songs. Soothing and pumping background music which harmonize very well with the presented situations. Very solid voice acting.
Gameplay: 8/10 - The phone interacting system feels very natural an works better than most other choice systems I've seen in VNs.

27877585.review:
There is also an anime for this light novel which I don't recommend as much as the light novel. I played the light novel before watching the anime which I think it was a good choice.

Steins;Gate is an excellent light novel, when I first learned it was about time travel I got bit worried that it would be very similiar to the other time traveling stories. But I was wrong it was really unique.

One of the pros were for me was it thought me a lot of things memes,facts,events. It also changed my view on life.
Every single character that got introduced plays a role in the story.

In the light novel there are multiple endings if you want to get the true ending I recommend you google it on how you could achieve it. But I don't think it really matters which ending you get first so you can always look up the guides afterwards.

If you have ever played a light novel before and you enjoyed it I can assure you that you will enjoy this one aswell. If you haven't played a light novel before and want to try one I recommend giving Steins;Gate a try.

Also there is an Steins;Gate movie called "Fuka Ryouiki no Déjà vu" which takes place in after the story ends. You can watch it afterwards if you liked the series.

27872414.review:
Знаете, я в последнее время вижу мало научной фантастики. Такое чувство, что она перестала быть именно научной, мне страшно смотреть на что-то новое, на абсолютно странные произведения с какой-то своей физикой и наукой. 
Но вот, появилось то, чего я так хотел. И это Steins;Gate. Путешествия во времени хоть и не являются самой нетривиальной темой, но здесь меня поразило все. Главный герой, которому я сопереживал как самому себе, чувства которого ясны как день любому, как и его развитие, которое абсолютно логично и приятно. 
Но для меня все держится, конечно, на самих путешествиях. То, как их обставили, то, как они выглядят и к чему приводят малейшие изменения - в первую очередь об этом Врата Штейна. То, как они могут выглядеть и то, нужны ли они нам? 
Эффект Бабочки, различные реально существующие слухи о подобных вещах, параллельные таймланы, неотвратимость грядущего и борьба, о которой никто так и не узнает. Вот, что такое для меня стали Врата.
Также я должен сказать, что это единственная визуальная новелла, в которую я играл - просто не люблю подобные вещи. Но жизнь, здешняя, как сейчас модно говорить "химия" отношений персонажей тронула меня до глубины души. 
Однозначно рекомендую.

27601532.review:
I played this game after watching the anime adaption, and whilst there are many similarites between them, I feel this game has more than enough different content to make it worth your time. If you haven't seen the anime, you get to go into this wonderful story blind, which I envy you for.

Basic Story overview (minor spoilers):
[spoiler]The story follows Okabe Rintarou, self-preclaimed Mad Scientist, and his group of friends in the 'Future Gadget Labratory'. The main focus of their adventures is their experimentation on "Future Gadget #8 'Phone Microwave' (name subject to change)", a microwave that seems to be able to send things back in time. Over the course of the story, as the charcters abuse this machine over and over, the stakes increase quite dramtically, and Okabe starts to realise just how immense the situation he's dealing with is.[/spoiler]

Being a visual novel, you best be prepared to sit down and read a lot. However, given the quality of the writing, as long as the idea of reading doesn't make you want to tear your eyes out, the narrative is very enjoyable to progress through, though some may consider it slow at the beginning. It also delivers several interesting theories and conjectures around the science that the story uses, as opposed to simply telling the audience that the science it uses works because it says so, though arguably there is some of that as well.

There is some level of interaction using Okabe's phone, but it's there more for triggering flags and getting some extra info on characters rather than as a massive gameplay feature. Most of the time big choices involving the phone are signposted quite obviously for the player, but others are more subtle, requiring either multiple runs or an online guide to progress through.

Art and music are both quite good, with the music setting the mood for some of the more intense scenes in the game rather nicely. If you've come from the anime adaption, the art will probably look weird to you, but personally I found the adjustment quite easy to manage.

The only thing I can think of as a deterrent would be the price tag, but in my opinion it's definitely worth the price of admission. The other potential negative would be replayability, as after completing all the routes, the only reason to play it again would be to re-experience the story, which whilst I'm sure many people would enjoy doing this, it's definitely not everyone's cup of tea. However, even wihtout replaying it, I'd still recommend it just for the first run through the game, which can easily take over 30 hours for the completition of every route.

Overall, this game gets a heavy recommendation from me. It's personally one of my favourite narratives to have read, and I would hope that you find the same level of enjoyment that I did.

更新：后来又去补了番剧，广播剧和剧场版电影。简直欲罢不能~剧场版大推荐！主角是助手哟
现在又想剁石头门零的典藏版了 中毒太深→_→

这是第一次写评测~ 最近两个星期花时间打出了全结局。不得不说是很优秀的作品。妥妥的10/10佳作。重金属画风一开始看着不舒服，久了其实也习惯了~只是上色风格比较奇异，人物立绘都很用心呢。几首BGM简直爱不释耳！声优也是极好的，Suzuha和Kurisu听到耳朵怀孕有没有！如果玩到一半觉得无聊，请务必坚持下去，最后打通之后看法会改变的（。前期的铺垫和日常积累的代入感真的很重要！个人感觉石头门对于不对二次元感冒的玩家也很值，毕竟故事本身实在是很优秀。

谈下自己的感想吧。

一开始我一直很在意当时认为的逻辑上的瑕疵，[spoiler]比如刚打出Faris结局的时候一直很纠结为什么Faris记得另一条世界线上的事之类的。当初还很纠结的就是，即使尝试去改变未来，难道“改变未来”的行为本身不是这个“未来”的一部分吗？[/spoiler]所以打出全结局之前，我一直都觉得这是剧情上的漏洞。

TE真的给了我很大的震撼，[spoiler]它把我之前所有的疑问都给解决了。原来每个人都有Reading Steiner，只是力量强弱的不同。原来Okabe那无数次的Time Leap就是新世界线不可缺少的一部分。不得不说真结局升华了整部作品。[/spoiler]除去TE之外的石头门，诚然很美好，但是总会觉得缺了什么，最重要的就是它们没能给本作中关于时间的疑问一个满意的答案：人类跟时间的关系到底是什么？命运呢？除去TE之外的结局，表达的相对浅层：人类是没办法完全左右时间的，该发生的事就是会发生。

TE非常不一样。虽然结果依旧是到达另一条世界线，带来的启发是其他几个结局不能比拟的。TE表达的观点更加完善：[spoiler]从Okabe第一次time leap之后，他的未来就注定了，他会到达命运石之门。这个想法很值得琢磨。既然是这样，那一切在Okabe出生的时候，甚至是这个世界开始的时候，就注定了吗？因为Okabe那些在不同的世界线上的战斗，不都是到达命运石之门不可或缺的吗？这是比另外的结局更深层面上的理解。TE上，Okabe并没有成功脱离的时空的束缚，而是从来没有脱离过。命运是从一开始就注定的，不管他做什么，都只是主观上的反抗时空，然而对一个从世界之外观察世界的神来说，他的一生从一开始就在剧本上写着了。同样是表达人类的无力，TE做得要好很多。[/spoiler]

小说没有告诉我们：不同的世界线到底是不是平行世界？我更愿意相信只有一个世界。当一条世界线变动的时候，它大概会变化到一个新的位置，得到新的变动率，但是原来的变动率所指的地方就只是虚无了吧。[spoiler]不然的话，为什么每个人都会有Reading Steiner呢？毕竟记忆是不会跨越不同的世界的吧。不过这么想也是单纯地希望那些痛苦的结局不再延续下去而已。[/spoiler] 
 
希望这个世界的未来是美好的。

El Psy Congroo.

27416921.review:
「それが運命石の扉（シュタインズ・ゲート）の選択か。」

疑似科学と言う言葉がある。理路整然としているが実際には存在しないデタラメな科学を指す言葉の１つである。
だが、疑似科学をテーマとした作品は現代に至る迄数多く発売されており1996年に発売された「この世の果てで恋を歌う少女YU-NO」は筒井康隆の小説「時をかける少女」をオマージュとした代表作品の１つと言えるであろう。
タイムリープ、タイムトラベルとは厳密には違う物のSFでの世界のお話であり現代に於いても実現していない。
だが、そのような行動が「もしも」実在したのならどのような行動を取るだろう。
過去の失敗を無かったことにすると言えば前述の「時をかける少女」の行動原理であり、使おうと思いたいと願う人間の大半が想像することだろう。
ただ、結果を変える事で歴史に矛盾が産み出されるとすればどうするか、歴史を変えてしまうことに責任は無いのだろうか？と--所謂タイムパラドックス理論とも言う、もしものお話ではあるのだが。

正に本作品は歴史の改変に於ける責任が１つの題材として存在している。偶然の産物によるタイムマシンの発明、興味本位からの実験で取り返しがつかなくなってしまった変化が襲う。
ただし、その変化は主人公以外誰も感知出来ない。他の誰も結果が変わった事に気付かないままその変化の中で生活していく事になるのだ。

本作品におけるシナリオは実に傑作と言える物だ。
と、言うのも過去にもこう言ったタイムトラベルがテーマとした作品は数多く存在しているが理論や、原理はあまり触れずただ存在してる事が前提として成り立つ作品が多い中、実際の出来事や実在の科学を混ぜ込む事で既成事実かの様な世界観をしっかりと作り上げているからだ。
(実際騙すテクニックとして嘘を混ぜると言うのは劇中でも示されている。)

また、科学やSFをテーマにした場合。文章がどうしても固くなったりしてとっつき辛い文章になったりするためどうしても敬遠しがちになるのだが、本作は発売当時のネットスラングや独特のキャラクター像でその欠点を大きく埋める事に成功している。
(ただ使われているネタは今となっては少々古いものもある。)

そして本作一番の魅力であり、作品を形作るのがキャラクター達の願った願いの目的とその本心である。その願いに迫ることで人物の魅力を掘り下げシナリオが彩られる。


主人公は痛い発言がメインで感情移入し辛い人物ではある。
ただし、去勢を張る発言ではなく、学生ではありながらも知識を用いて実際に行動出来る有能な人物でもあるのだ。
その本質は話の展開と共に彼が持つ確固たる思いと共に明かされていくがレビューでは触れない。

全ての登場人物を見た際、本作が抱える一番の欠点が存在している。
主人公の相棒であり、キーパーソンとも言える橋田至である。
彼は前述でも触れた「理論で成り立つ世界観」における異質な存在であるのだ。
彼はとんでもない能力を有している。ネタバレとなるため伏せてはおくが彼の能力の由縁や何故有しているかは一切の説明もなく、ただ存在してしまっているのだ。
散々他の要素で理論を成り立たせていただけにその点だけは本当に残念である。

シナリオの話は一旦置いておくとしてゲームシステムの話も少ししよう。
本作品は所謂、ビジュアルノベル(VN)と言われるものである。
VNは基本進行は選択肢で可変するものであり、プレイヤーが自身で選択を行う事で変化を生み出していくものである。
懐かしの携帯電話を用いたフォーントリガーと呼ばれるシステムを用いているのだが(英語版ではPhoneTorigger そのままの意味である。)本作品では選択肢を選択肢として感じさせない様に作られており、その世界観を損ねない。
この作りは煩わしさもあるものの、劇中で自由に、どの様な場面でも携帯電話を見ることが出来るため、正に大成功と言える仕様であろう。
蝶の羽ばたきが遠く離れた地で竜巻を起こす。所謂バタフライエフェクトと呼ばれるたとえ話の様に、その影響は必ず何処かで発動する。物語の真相に辿り着くには何度も何度もその影響を重ね合わせていかなくてはならない。

そして、この紹介を読んでもしあなたの心に触れる物があるのならば、この素晴らしいSF作品を読破してみるのはどうだろうか？
あなたの心や人生にも、必ず大きなバタフライエフェクトが起こることであろう。

27302440.review:
"Tuturuuuu~"
Ich habe früher ab und an den Begriff "Steins;Gate" gehört und wusste nichts damit anzufangen... Als ich dann das Spiel mit dem Namen auf Steam gesehen habe musste ich es einfach aus Neugier einmal anspielen. Ich hatte keine großen Erwartungen, sondern wollte es wie gesagt einfach nur ein bisschen anspielen...und wie ich falsch lag mit dem "anspielen". Das Spiel hat es geschafft mich von der ersten Minute in den Bann zu ziehen! Zugegeben sind die ersten Spielstunden nicht sonderlich spannend im Vergleich zum Rest, allerdings mit einem umso besseren Humor ausgestatet, den man wirklich selten findet. Das Speilgenre ist ein Visual Novel, also viel selbst zum Steuern etc. gibt es nicht und man hat einiges zu lesen. Das bedeutet allerdings nicht, dass man keinen Einfluss hat, denn man kann die Story mit unterschiedlichen Antworten auf bestimmte Entscheidungen zu unterschiedlichen Enden führen. Und jedes davon hat seinen eigenen Charme, doch selten habe ich etwas gesehen was mich so aus den Socken gehauen hat, wie das "True ending". Einfach ohne Worte und das sollte jeder einmal selbst erleben!
Die Grafik ist echt schön, auch wenn die Charaktere etwas von dem normalen Anime-Stil abweichen, aber genau in diesen Stil habe ich mich etwas verliebt.
Die Syncho ist auf japanisch und obwohl ich Japanisch selbst noch nicht verstehe, schafft sie es die Emotionen so klar rüber zu bringen und zusammen mit der Story sind die "Onion cutting ninjas" oft nicht weit entfernt! :D
Dazu tragen dann natürlich auch noch die Musik, welche einfach sagenhaft ist, und die Charaktere bei. Letztere sind verdammt gut geschrieben und jeder der Charaktere im Spiel führt eine Entwicklung durch, wodurch sich keiner wie einen Neben-Charakter anfühlt. Doch bei weitem hebt sich aus allen der Hauptcharakter Okabe Rintarou hervor, welcher unter dem Namen "Hououin Kyouma" seine verrückte Wissenschaftler-Seite voll ausnutzt und mir dabei oft ein Lachen ins Gesicht gezaubert hat. 
Über die Story an sich will ich hier eher nichts sagen, da ich finde diese sollte jeder einfach selbst genießen, weil ab einem bestimmten Punkt kann man seine Augen nicht mehr vom BIldschirm abwenden. :D

Mich hat dieses Spiel verzaubert und ich bereue nicht es gespielt zu haben, denn es ist seither mein Lieblingsspiel! Wer nicht so sehr auf lesen steht kann sich auch den Anime zu der Serie anschauen. Dieser ist auch verdammt gut, aber mir gefällt das detailreichere des Visual Novels einfach mehr...aber das sind nur persönliche Präferenzen. :D

Auch da bald der Nachfolger "Steins;Gate 0" erscheint ist es natürlich nicht schlecht den vorherigen Teil schonmal gespielt zu haben :D

Für mich ein "Must-play"! 
"This is the choice of Steins;Gate"

10/10

-El Psy Congroo

27178185.review:
Loved the anime adaptation and decided to buy the VN when it came to Steam. Probably the best ~30€ I've spent. This is the first version of this visual novel I've read so I can't do any comparison between this and earlier releases. There are a lot of other rewiews that do that so you should go to read them if you're interested in that.

Many of you (like I was) are propably thinking: "Is it worth buying if you've already watched the anime?". Simple answer: Yes. Why? Let me tell you shortly. [b]Those not interested in comparison between the anime and visual novel can skip the next two paragraphs.[/b]

While the main storyline is the same the visual novel has a lot more content in it. It gives much more insight in the eight main characters' backgrounds, reasons to their actions and interactions with each other. What the anime especially lacks is the most of Okabe's (main character's) inner monologues. They give so much info about his character and why he acts and behaves like he does.

The anime series has only one ending aka "true ending" of the VN. Well it would have been very confusing (and silly) if they'd have done all 6 endings in one series. Even when you follow the true ending storyline the story is more detailed and a bit different in a few scenes. I must say that I learned a lot more about the universe of Steins;Gate (and the whole Science Adventure series) when I read this VN. The anime apadtation was great, heck it's #4 top rated anime at MAL. But there's just so much you can fit in 24 episodes.


[b]Here's some pros/cons:[/b]


[b]Pros:[/b]
- A well written story about time travel, decisions and consequenses, the cause and the effect...
- Well explained and beliveable theories about time travel.
- 6 different endings depending on your decisions throughout the game.
- Interesting characters with lots of character development.
- Well made voice-overs with the same voice actors from the anime.
- Amazing soundtrack.
- Took me ~70 hours to 100% complete this so there's a lot of content.


[b]Neutral (why some people may/may not like this):[/b]
- It's a visual novel. Lots of reading with little interaction.
- Starts slowly with lots of science stuff about time travel.
- Different art style than the anime series.
- Only Japanese voice-overs.


[b]Cons:[/b]
- Not enough トゥットゥルー
- Seriously, can't think of any flaws since most of the bugs/translation errors have been fixed.


[b]10/10[/b] Highly recommended to the fans of the anime series and those who like sci-fi, mystery/thriller and a bit of romance. Worth every €/$/£/yen even at full price.

[b] El Psy Kongroo.[/b]

27072703.review:
支持原生1080P分辨率是本次Steam版本相较于已有版本的最大区别（并非简单的画面拉伸）。从游戏性与剧情来说，购买本游戏的一定已从多种渠道接触了本作品，质量不必多言；尚未接触到的玩家一定要尝试这部科幻气息的中二文艺恋爱剧，MAGES并不会给你带来失望。

本作依然延续了MAGES，或者5pb.长期以来的无黄油视觉小说特色（业界为数不多的清流），让玩家能够更纯粹的体验游戏剧本带来的乐趣。在此之外接轨时代，标签分明的登场人物会引得熟悉ACG领域的玩家会心一笑。作为妄想科学ADV系列作品的第二弹，真实与虚构的碰撞；科学与妄想的交织，营造出迷离之美。

游戏作为视觉小说，采取传统的章节性叙事。各章标题中可以一窥剧情推进与人物发展梗概。引入手机短信作为引导剧情发展的关键要素，极富时代性的分支抉择。在线性的时间点上，接触不同结局之后，游戏真结局又重衔起始，构筑出圆满丰富的游戏体验。

游戏对于多语言文本支持依然稍显欠缺，加之原文不少剧情典故涉及不少2ch留言板用语，推荐有能力的玩家使用日语文本能够获得最完整的游戏体验。对于原语苦手的玩家，使用搜索引擎，也存在支持正版游戏成就解锁的语言翻译补丁（目前是默许状态，但不保证使用第三方程序在之后引起官方惩罚）。

27045668.review:
この作品を私が遊んだのは、ちょうど小説『夏への扉』やら映画『バタフライ・エフェクト』やら、そういった時間跳躍ものにはまっていた時期になります。ええ、中二病です。
もう、当時ほどにはそういったジャンルを素直に受け入れられるほど若くはなく、それでも懐かしさからまたやりたくなり、この『STEINS;GATE』を購入しました。

もしかしたら、過去を美化しているだけでやり直してもがっかりするだけかもしれない、秋葉原なんて画廊の姉ちゃんに行く度に捕まって絵を買わされそうになった嫌な思い出しかない、思い出は思い出のままにしたほうがいいんじゃないか、そういった不安もありました。

しかし、やはり面白いものは時を経ても面白いのです。
日本のサブカルチャーとSFのある意味見事な融和。サブカルチャーが過ぎて、英語などの外国語に直されたところで本当に通じるのか心配になる内容です。日本人にすら通じるか心配になるというのに。
しかし、やはり面白いものは面白いのです。

27026070.review:
One of my favorite anime of all time. The basic story revolves around time travel and potential consequences of having such power, to say much more would spoil it. To those that have seen the anime I would still recommend this as it gives further character development and shows some potential storylines via alternate endings. I think playing this after having watched the anime makes the visual novel even better with being able to pay extra attention to foreshadowing and hints knowing the major plot points that are coming up. The anime follows the "true ending" so it's worth exploring all the other endings for new content. And despite revolving heavily on supernatural elements like time travel, it stays relatively grounded by clearly establishing the rules of time travel that this universe decides to follow.

The actual gameplay is that of a typical visual novel. It's a lot of reading with voice acted dialogue and a handful of decisions that determine extra scenes/the endings. The choices in this game come in the form of cell phone text replies. So gameplay is minimal, but is expected of the genre. Like any other games of the genre, the draw is the story and character interactions.

As for negatives, it's still a visual novel. A lot of people don't enjoy the genre for the lack of gameplay and this story isn't amazing enough to turn people into fans of the genre. There's still the anime if you want to story. The start of the story is also extremely slow, but necessary. The format of being a visual novel makes it even slower than the anime (which is often the biggest criticism). It's worth it for the payoff in later chapters though.

Запоминающиеся персонажи, которые несмотря на всю свою первоначальную шаблонность, отлично раскрываются; продуманная сюжетная линия, в которой нет практически ничего лишнего, а каждый шаг так или иначе обоснован; отличный саундтрек Такеши Або с песнями в исполнении Ито Канако, особая атмосфера — вас ждёт действительно качественная игра, которая не испортит впечатления какими-либо некачественными элементами и определённо стоит своих денег.

Bought this on a whim. 48 hours later, I am a Steins;Gate fan. 

Equal parts humorous and poignant, from the outset I found the writing and art so engaging that I spent the best part of the next week just playing it nonstop until I'd seen every part. I'm sad it's over.

26549546.review:
All in all, STEINS;GATE is a great visual novel. The art style is a nice take on the traditional manga/anime graphical tropes and the true conclusion is among the best I've seen in a narrative game. The twists are well done. The voice acting is impressive. The characters are well written. The game successfully tries to stay interactive thanks to its phone mechanic. But the most likeable achievement of the game is the way it sticks with its own rules regarding time travel. No deus ex machina here : it's all cause and consequence.

However, the game is pulled back by a set of small issues, none of them being gamebreaking though. The awesome soundtrack is poorly managed during some scenes and the number of tracks sometimes appears to be scarce. There are also frequent pacing issues : the game does take its time to take off, and it's not helped by the scientific babble that doesn't always come in handy. Don't mistake me : bringing science into video games is awesome. But that should be done in a way that does not alter the experience (so that people might eventually get interested in it).

8/10

26538088.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]

[b]Story[/b]: 10/10 - A really well thought out tale of time travel with multiple endings, all satisfying and hard to poke holes in.
[b]Graphics[/b]: 9/10 - beautiful artwork, well animated when needed to be animated.
[b]Sound[/b]: 10/10 - amazing soundtrack, some of(if not THE) best voice acting I've ever heard, even though its not my primary language. Tutturu!
[b]Gameplay[/b]: 10/10 - multiple endings, hidden paths to fun collectibles, interesting way to make you choose different routes.

[b]Final Score[/b]: 10/10 - The best VN on steam bar none. It's perfection, perhaps a slightly slow start and can be very confusing to begin with, but given time it all comes together to create a masterpeice.

[h1]Longer Review[/h1]

Steins;Gate follows Okabe Rintaro on a journey through time, pretty much everything I can tell you about the story would be a spoiler, so I'll leave it at that. It's quite simply a masterpeice in storytelling. Every twist is unforeseen or if it is foreseen then the twist itself has a twist. Each ending has obviously been crafted with love and care as they feel like fully fleshed out endings, not just tacked on extra's after the story had been finished. With time travel being the major focus, it would be easy to fill your plot with holes, poke at the plot and its pretty difficult to find a flaw. Superb writing. The only issue(and this goes for the anime too) is that it can be a bit overwhelming to begin with and it throws information at you, scientific theory and craziness. If you give it a chance, it rewards you by making sense and explaining itself, its not scared of making you yourself connect the dots though, so if you are planning on not paying attention or giving it more than an hours worth of your time, then this is not for you.

The graphics are brilliant, they're unique, styleish and there's lots of different CG's to look at. The characters expressions are not repeated too much and when they are animated they don't look out of place. Not TOO much fanservice as well, but there is one or two fan servicey scenes.

The voice acting makes the game at times, its stellar work, my native language is not Japanese, but I found myself just listening to the acting because it conveyed the message perfectly. The songs and music throughout as well were absolutely brilliant. I struggle to even think of a VN that comes on par with the voice acting.

The gameplay is brilliant for a VN too, its not just a little box with two choices making it very easy to just lose your immersion. Steins;Gate uses a complex system of text messages to guide your choices, so even when you are making choices you never feel out of place, you feel like you are texting a friend. Same goes for the collectibles, you might get sent a wallpaper for your phone from a friend, or a new ringtone! Powers really in your phone!

If you have any interest in anime or VN's, this is a must buy, its probably the best VN on steam.

26537613.review:
Steins;Gate...
How do I even begin describing this wonderful game/anime?
I'll start with how I personally fell in love with it.

Time leap back to about 2-3 summers ago when I wanted to try to get into anime. The first one I fully watched that summer was Wolf's Rain. Then Madoka Magica, then finally, Steins;Gate. Later on, I watched about 10 more anime series, but none of them could ever live up to the greatness of Steins;Gate. After I had finished the show, I became obsessed with it; heck, I still listen to the wonderful soundtrack while doing homework. Every part of it is so complexly amazing. What makes Steins;Gate so amazing? It's just like any other time travel thing, right?

It's really difficult to describe what makes Steins;Gate such a beautiful show/visual novel without giving too much away. They start out slow, introducing you to 8 main characters who you unsuspectedly become attached to. Each of them is outstandingly fleshed out, and when bad things begin happening, you begin to realize how delved into the show you were. 

I've always been a lover of time travel and sci-fi shows. I've watched Doctor Who, Madoka Magica, Doctor Strange, and I've played To the Moon and some other games that have the "choices matter" theme. I've also read books like 11/22/63 recently. The idea that someone would go back in time over and over again and possibly break the laws of physics just for someone they hold dear has however been a little weird to me. I never really understood why someone would potentially cause problems in the space  time continuum, especially since most time travel things never explain time travel theories very well and if they do, they often ignore certain parts of them. 

In my opinion, Steins;Gate is one of the first shows/visual novels that successfully accomplishes this goal. While the anime isn't as descriptive of time travel theories, I believe both do the job pretty well. I learned more about time travelling in this series than I have any other.

Ever since I've watched the show and found out there was a visual novel from the point of view of the main character, I immediately hoped to play it. When it finally came to Steam, one of my good friends gifted it to me knowing I would love it. And I did.

I was worried that I would be bored while reading this since I already watched the anime a few times and I even watched the shorts and the movie. I've never even played a visual novel before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. Due to the different point of view, 6 different endings, and extra content, I was extremely content with the visual novel. By the way, a visual novel is exactly what it sounds like, an interactive book with pictures and music.

This all being said, I strongly recommend purchasing the game or watching the anime at least. Its sense of humor, heart-felt friendships, intricate storyline, and beautiful artwork is no match for any other. The main character's loss of sanity and constant moral dilemmas is both sad and interesting to watch and the intriguing dialogue he has with his friends is purely heart-warming.

I hope I have made it clear as to why I love Steins;Gate so much, but it's  difficult to profess love for something like this without spoiling it. Buy the game!! or watch the show!

El. Psy. Congroo.

This visual novel is a true 10/10

 Что!? 30$? Это должно быть шутка... Неужели снова происки Организации?
...
  Похоже это дело для безумного ученого.
  Раз таков выбор Врат Штейна." [/i]


 Не прошло и семи лет, как одну из лучших научно-фантастических новелл Steins;Gate завезли в стим [spoiler]хотя нет, прошло[/spoiler]. Что мы имеем: тщательно проработанные персонажи, приятная озвучка, закрученный сюжет и просто фантастической музыкальная начинка. Сказать что это шедевр - ничего не сказать, лучшее что я когда либо видел.

 [h1] Графон. [/h1] 

 Большое спасибо 5pb/Nitro+ за перерисовку в фулл хд 1080, разница с 2009 версией просто колоссальная. Вся картинка яркая и красочная, радует глаз, удобный интерфейс, необычная рисовка, красивые спрайты и детализированные фоны. В общем все на высшем уровне.

 [h1] Геймплей. [/h1]
 
 Особо понравилась оригинальная система принятия решений. Помимо чтения, игроку дают влиять на развитие событий через мобильный телефон. Как кому ответить решает игрок, и от этого зависит концовка, коих шесть штук.

 [h1] Сюжет.  [/h1]

 Сюжет действительно навороченный, очень большое внимание уделено мелочам, которые играют огромную роль в развязке. В отличии от сериала, в новелле сюжета охватывается гораздо больше. Некоторые моменты было сложно понять и мне пришлось лезть на вики по Вратам чтобы понять что там происходило)) для таких как я там выложили большую схему с таблицей с пояснением всех мировых линий (типа такой http://steins-gate.wikia.com/wiki/Timeline ). А сериал по новелле получился крайне удачным. Все на высоте: и рисовка, и актеры, и музыка; просто нет слов.

[spoiler]короче топ 10/10[/spoiler]

26462490.review:
Tuturu~

Hey there fellow Visual Novel players ! I really enjoyed this game and I wanted to give it a review. 

I will start on the technical perspective. 
To be honest I had trouble throughout the game. No real game breaker but seriously annoying if you dunno how to fix it. It was about a bug with a currupted save file where my screen got shot down everytime I tried to exit the game. ( There is a bug threat about it. For me the solution was to plug my screen out and in again ). 
Besides that I had no issues at all on the technical side of this game and as far as I know the dev's are already working on the issue stated above. 

I guess thats pretty much it about the technical perspective since the sound, the graphics and whatsoever didnt cause any trouble. 

I want to say that before I played this game I kinda avoided the Sci-Fi genre. Some might say thats not Sci-Fi but for me it definitely has a SF touch to it. Or its just the fact that everything related to the future and not to the past feels like Sci-Fi for me? I dunno (>")>.
But even though I was suspicious I am very happy that I checked out Steins:Gate because it has a wonderful, mysterious, thrilling and interesting theme. 
I won't spoil anything on here so I guess I keep it simple and just say that this game was far more than expected and quality wise ( Sounds, Graphics, Interactions, CG's etc. ) definitely the best Visual Novel I played so far. 
The story is really catching and never stops to keep the waves of interesting stuff, humor, mystery, fear and whatsoever coming. I felt like I was riding an emotional rollercoaster at some part X.X  
Okay let's face it.. I cried a shit ton :'( ... <("<).
And Steins:Gate has something I enjoy alot in a book/VN/movie or any way to tell a story. It puts every little tiny piece together. What feels confusing just takes time to build up. Everything ties together very well. I really enjoy that. It gives the feeling that there is a red string you've been following the whole time. Everything is connected.

So in the end, all I have to say is that this is a masterpiece in my opinion, and everyone who plays VN's not only for naughty stuff ( let's face it there are alot of them.. no offense though ) but for awesome stories this thing has to be in your library.
 
Enjoyed. Stole my sleep. Stole my emotions. Made me cry. And gave me an awesome story that I won't forget. 

( little pun in the end )
But let's face it, you will get this game because its not your choice. 
It's the choice of Steins:Gate. 
El psy congroo. 

Note: English is not my main language so please excuse any grammar or spelling mistakes.~

~ ShikiX

I'm sorry, but I uninstalled and refunded after experiencing a couple issues.

My primary gripe is that, when exiting the application, Steins;Gate had a tendency of crashing my display drivers, which requires either a restart or unplugging/replugging in my displays. A rather annoying issue. I didn't check too hard to see if it was an issue using multiple monitors, but I did the usual (reinstall graphics drivers, restart PC, etc) before concluding it specifically as an issue with SG.  

My other main issue with the game is the monospace text used everywhere. The text is way too large, and the space after punctuation characters was horrid to look at, which I couldn't get past considering the previous JAST PC port didn't have this issue.

It feels like this iteration of Steins;Gate is a major step back in comparison to what already existed. It's just a shame the JAST version couldn't be put onto Steam. I will continue to check up on this version from time to time, and will repurchase if the above issues are worked on in a future patch.

26245183.review:
Steins;Gate - это вторая и самая успешная игра в серии научно-фантастических визуальных новелл объединённых под общим названием Science Adventure. События Steins;Gate разворачиваются примерно через год после событий первой игры серии (Chaos;Head). В игре есть множество отсылок к Chaos;Head, но сюжетно игра является совершенно самостоятельной. Вы ничего не потеряете в плане сюжета, если начнёте знакомство с серией сразу со Steins;Gate.

[h1]О сюжете (без спойлеров) и механике игры[/h1]
Сюжет игры очень закручен, а наличие машины времени всё только усугубляет (в хорошем смысле этого слова). У игры есть несколько разных концовок и одна "настоящая" концовка, прийти к которой без руководства довольно сложно.

Одной из ключевых фишек игры является мобильный телефон, именно с помощью него вы влияете на развитие сюжета. То есть вместо того чтобы выбрать один из вариантов ответа, как это обычно происходит в новеллах, вы производите некоторые действия с телефоном: совершаете вызовы, отвечаете или не отвечаете на входящие звонки, а так же ведёте переписку по электронной почте (путём выбора варианта ответа :) ).

[h1]Про отсылки в игре[/h1]
Игра изобилует огромным числом отсылок к известным мангам и аниме-сериалам, а так же в целом к отаку-культуре в Японии. Многие японские мемы не стали мемами ни у нас, ни на западе, поэтому без справочника со многими отсылками так просто не разобраться. Благо, в самой игре есть такой справочник. По понятным причинам, напрямую написать названия манг и сериалов авторы не могли, но если вы с ними знакомы, то без труда догадаетесь о чём речь. В крайнем случае можно поискать в гугле.

Но даже если вы не поймёте ни одну из отсылок, то ничего особо не потеряете. Отсылки служат в качестве комедийной составляющей и не связаны напрямую с сюжетом.

[h1]О серии Science Adventure[/h1]
На данный момент серия состоит из 4-х основных игр (в порядке выхода):
Chaos;Head
Steins;Gate
Robotics;Notes
Chaos;Child

Каждая из игр берёт какую-то научную идею и разворачивает вокруг неё закрученный и увлекательный сюжет. В случае Steins;Gate такой идеей стала машина времени. События всех игр в серии разворачиваются в одной и той же вселенной, и некоторые из персонажей даже перешли в последующие игры. Но, как я уже сказал ранее, Steins;Gate связан с Chaos;Head только отсылками, никаких персонажей из неё в Steins;Gate не перешло.

И всё же для полноты картины я бы посоветовал сначала прочитать Chaos;Head. Она не была официально переведена на английский, но существует фанатский перевод. Кроме того есть и аниме-адаптация игры, но она получилась не очень удачной.

[h1]Аниме-адаптация Steins;Gate[/h1]
Очень многие фанаты серии начали своё знакомство с ней именно с сериала по новелле Steins;Gate. Сериал получился крайне удачным, и был высоко оценён фанатами оригинальной игры. Разумеется, узкие временные рамки сериала не позволили вместить весь материал новеллы. Есть некоторые упущения, какие-то небольшие события были поменяны местами, зачем-то добавили ВНЕЗАПНО останавливающиеся часы. Но в целом сериал достаточно точно пересказывает события основной сюжетной ветки игры.

Лучше, конечно, сначала прочитать новеллу, и только после неё смотреть сериал, но даже если вы уже видели анимешку, то я бы всё равно посоветовал прочитать новеллу. Новелла имеет несколько разных концовок и гораздо больше подробностей, включая знаменитую лекцию Курису про путешествия во времени.

[h1]Немного об игре Steins;Gate 0 (без спойлеров)[/h1]
Steins;Gate 0 - это нечто вроде сиквела к этой игре, его ещё пока не перевели на английский, но обещают сделать в этом году. До прочтения оригинального Steins;Gate, я крайне не советую искать информацию по 0, так как можно легко проспойлериться. Даже простое описание игры содержит очень серьёзные спойлеры по первой части. Английская ПК версия пока даже не анонсирована. Но учитывая наличие японской ПК версии и анонсированную английскую консольную версию, вполне можно надеяться, что английская версия появится в Стиме.

[h1]Кому будет интересна эта новелла?[/h1]
- Тем, кто любит научную фантастику.
- Тем, кто любит аниме-культуру.
- Да и вообще всем тем, кто любит лихо закрученные сюжеты с неожиданными поворотами.

26242577.review:
If you read this review you are probably like me and watched the Steins;Gate anime before for whatever reason stumbling across the visual novel on steam and are asking yourself now "Is this game still worth buying even though i know all the major plottwists and the true-route?"

The short answer is in my opinion: yes it is. If you enjoyed the anime as a whole and not just the first or the second half, it's definetly worth buying for multiple reasons.

First of all the game gives you a lot more information on the time-travel stuff that's going on and even discusses some theories that are actual theories in real-life and it's pretty well researched by the devs. However it never goes that deep into science that you, as a normal person, cannot understand what the characters are talking about. So it's really well blalanced and gives you something to think about while reading.

Second the characters get a lot more depth. I guess that shouldn't come as a surprise, that a visual novel with around 50 hour length develops the characters much more than the anime with around 8 hours. However not just that the side characters like Faris, Lukako, etc. get more depth they also get their very own ending route, that, even though it's non-canonical, is worth experiencing.

Third the art and the soundtrack in this game are awesome. But if you've watched the anime and checked the screenshots above the review section you should know that already.

Fourth the inner thoughts of Okabe gives you a lot more insight on how he goes through this whole journey. Even though the anime does a good job in portraying how he kinde descends into madness because of the constant time-looping, reading about his inner thoughts gives you a much better picture about the whole situation. Also having his phone accessable and reading his e-mail exchange with the fellow characters is pretty well done.

Fifth you support the devs. I mean even if nothing from the above convinced you to buy the game because the price is too high or you are still not sure, just wait for winter-sale or something and buy it then, even if it's just to support the devs. They just recently released the Steins;Gate 0 visual novel and it might get a steam release as well, if the support is big enough here. Who knows...

All in all it was a really nice experience to read through the novel, even with prior knowlege of the anime. Sure it does spoiler the major plottwists for you, however it shouldn't hinder the enjoyment you get out of the game.

Also sorry for possible grammar-typo mistakes, english is not my first language.

Recommandé par un ami, j'ai commencé par l'anime et je peux vous dire qu'il m'a diverti à tel point que le considère maintenant et peut-être pour toujours comme le meilleur anime ayant jamais existé !

La musique est superbe et correspond bien au thème et aux diverses situations vécues par Hououin Kyouma et ses compagnons. Le doublage est parfait. Cette histoire mérite que l'on fasse l'éloge de sa qualité visuelle et scénaristique mais je trouve que c'est vraiment dommage qu'il ne soit pas si connu en France, sauf chez les vrais otakus...

Bref, à lire, regarder et jouer sans modération !

El. Psy. Kongroo.

26192435.review:
Overall a disapointing read. Catgirl was awesome. Protagonist was cool during the beginning of the story, but lost some of his charm in the second half. Tusendere was flat. Childhood friend wasn't annoying, but wasn't particularly charming either. Sidekick wasn't funny enough. Plot was remarkably simplistic for a story based on time travel, and not in a good way. Psuedoscience got boring after a while. The translators failed to rise to the challege of making all the 2channel memes entertaining. I would have prefered more agressive localization. Overall I didn't feel attached to the characters.

As for the plot, I kept thinking "ok now that they've laid the groundwork the plot will start getting interesting" but it never happened. It's a very umm accessible plot, but that's not what I was looking for.

*** SPOILERS ***

Some plot points were way too predictable. I guessed that the CRTs were connected to the time travel capabilities pretty early one. Also when Part Time Warrior revealed she was from the future my only reaction was "we know -.-" I guessed that Daru was the time travel's father early too, which ruined some of the emotional impact of the reveal. It was pretty frustrating watching him rewind time five or six times to save the childhood friend when I could tell by the second go around that it was useless.

Some of the side endings were good, but the true ending was kind of bland. Bad endings would have added a lot to the story and it's disapointing that there weren't any.

The morality of time travel and playing god wasn't sufficently explored. I would have loved a confrontation with the council of 200 or what have you, so they could explain from their perspectives why they felt like they were doing the write thing, but that didn't happen disapointingly. I would have also liked for them to travel to the future and see what it's like first hand, but that also didn't happen.

26149369.review:
[b]TLDR:[/b] Highly recommneded but use a guide.
Here's the guide: http://www.mediafire.com/file/385dx1y9k169tkw/Steins%3BGate+Flowchart.pdf

[b]Pros[/b]

Great story. Probably not completely plot-hole-free, but nothing with time travel in it ever is.

The Feels. Oh man. All the emotions.

Plenty of length for the money. My first playthrough without a guide took 40 hours, then another 20 to go through and get all the endings. Be patient through the credits for all of the endings.

[b]Cons[/b]

Pioloting the story is virtually impossible without a guide because of the phone-based choice system. You might want with all your heart to make a certain choice, but becuase you chatted about something nonsensical and unrelated on your phone with someone two chapters ago, you're SOL.

Some of the female characters... most of the female characters... could get on your nerves if you aren't down with anime  depictions of weak / airheaded women. Some of them are fairly endearing, some of them are pathological. Fortunately, there's Kurisu. It's worth looking past.

Lots of heavy-handed exposition. You'll never be lost about the plot because it's always spelled out for you just what's going on. Maybe that's a good thing given the temporal complications, but I think it could stand to be less hand-holdy.

Slowish start. Personally it didn't bother me, but I've heard other people complain. Only in hind sight do you really see how slow it was. Stick with it until the [VERY MILD SPOILER] bomb scare at the train station.

[b]Other stuff[/b]
When you're done, seek out the movie "Steins;Gate: Fuka Ryouiki no Deja Vu". It takes place after the visual novel/anime. The OVA was very short and didn't feel essential but if you can get your hands on it watch it before the movie. It continues from the anime and covers some stuff that happens after the VN.

26096480.review:
[b]玩后感：[/b]
几年前刚接触这番的时候，看了一两集我就觉得什么鬼玩意儿，好无聊，弃了。没想到今时今日我化身为凤凰院凶真，走上了拯救老婆的道路。[spoiler] 我只能说这一切都是命运石之门的选择! [/spoiler]
当剧情进入正片，我一次又一次地去救我青梅竹马的时候，我能感受到我的痛苦，我的浑噩，一切都是那么真实，一个懒到要废掉的闲鱼，为了救老婆，玩游戏的这四天自动八点起，脑子里就怀着一个信念，救老婆！你要说我中二吗，不，不是的。这正是游戏的魅力所在！游戏比动画更有代入感！游戏中的小姐姐每说一句话都牵动着我的心。为什么会这样呢，我明明是喜欢异性的啊。这只能说明，我已经不是我，我是凤凰院凶真！我是要成为救世主的男人！我牺牲了太多，当我看到这么多女孩子向我投怀送抱而我不得不放弃她们时真的觉得很惊恐，甚至还想把网名改成伤尽天下女人心。但是看到太多人用我就放弃了。这游戏极度考验人性，你们要小心了。我这么正直专一的人，都居然想和所有的小姐姐谈恋爱。我变了，´_>`，
[spoiler] 而且当ルカ子说自己是男生就不得不隐藏自己的心意时，我真的很心疼他！ [/spoiler]这一刻我在心里咆哮:是男生也没有关系！你倒是说啊宝贝！你这么可爱我也很喜欢你的！

但是！这一切都是值得的！我不断进行时间跳跃！[spoiler] 甚至还捅了我老婆一刀。 [/spoiler] 可这是必然结果，这一刻我理解了之前的剧情铺垫都不是白费，前面的内容完美地和后面的剧情链接在一起，啊，所以才说是神作啊。
作为玩家唯一难受的是这画师的透视画的不太好，有几张图图透视画的有点崩就会让人不舒服。不过也是小问题，毕竟翻一翻页图就过去了。

26081416.review:
While I dislike disagreeing with such an overwhelming consensus, I can't stand this game. This is probably a failure on my part since so many people are rarely wrong simultaneously, but so far as I can tell, the story depends on the protagonists being nincompoops, except when it requires them to be competent; sheer idiots, except when it requires them to be intelligent, and utter jerks, except when it requires them to show a Deep and Caring Heart so we go aww. The events of the story are determined less by the preexisting rules of the setting and the nature of the characters, and more by what the author thought would provoke the emotional reaction he wanted to provoke.

I spent thirteen hours getting to the point where the main plot starts and another three and a half deciding I didn't like the main plot. Having gotten to a secondary character's ending which utterly failed to resolve anything, I decided that it wasn't worth going back to the start and replaying it with the help of a guide to see an ending that did. Maybe I'll watch the anime if I want to know how it really ends. Or maybe not. Based on what I've seen, I don't think I'd like the kind of ending that this author would like to write.

26052138.review:
A brief explanation, first - Steins;gate is a Visual Novel following the misadventures of one Okabe Rintaro, a man who - together with his super hacka lab assistant Hashida Itaru - unwittingly invents a machine that can send messages backwards in time, and the consequences of toying around with this invention.

There isn't much in the way of gameplay - this is a Visual Novel after all - but you can still control the course of the story by choosing to send or reply to messages when prompted, make or receive phone calls - or ignore them, too. Most of the characters in the story will also send messages to you from time to time, to which you can respond by highlighting a keyword in their message, allowing you to build a better picture of their personalities.


For those of you that enjoyed the anime, and enjoy reading, I will say - buy the game. It's that simple.
The anime is faithful to its source material, but there's only so much that can be encapsulated in 25 20-minute episodes. And the alternate endings will be completely new to you, too, which is a huge plus.

For those of you who *haven't* seen the anime - well, I'll start by saying I'm jealous of you, because the impact of a large number of scenes or twists was lessened because I knew what was coming. And I still laughed, still smiled... and I still cried. That I knew what was coming and still got caught up in the story is a worthy accomplishment.
I don't normally get overly emotional when it comes to video games, but the writing is exceptional, and the Japanese voice actors are beyond incredible. (For what it's worth, I generally prefer listening to English dubs, but the fact there isn't one for the Steins;Gate visual novel really isn't a downside.)

Overall, I'm very happy I've finally had the chance to play this game through to the True End, and grateful it's been made available on Steam :D

25976201.review:
Masterpiece. One of the most complex, emotional  and well-fleshed-out time travel stories every written. In the 34 hours it took for me to get 4 out of 5 endings (one of which was the true ending,) I've experienced almost every humanly emotion possible: from happiness, to fear, to anxiety, to anger, to sorrow, to disgust, to bitterness, to despair, to hope, and even to love. Masterful writing, characterization, atmosphere, and soundtrack.

As someone who played the VN first and then watched the anime, I can surely say the VN is superior to the anime in almost every way. You get much more time to get really attached to the characters; you gain much deeper insight into Okabe's character and internal struggles, and you get much more detailed technical explanations of how time travel works.  I was actually blown away by how extensively the visual novel discussed actual quantum mechanics and metaphysics; the writer REALLY did his research. 

But most important of all, there is no comparison between the emotional impact of the visual novel versus that of the anime. The visual novel's sublime soundtrack, voice acting, and pacing all combine to form one of the most turbulent emotional roller coasters I have ever had the luxury of experiencing. 
There is just no way to describe it; the atmosphere of intrigue and raw emotions that ooze from just about every crevice of the game is something that is to be experienced, not described. 

TLDR: If you havent seen the anime then this is the definitively best way to experience the story
But if you have seen the anime already buy it anyway because the masterful writing and soundtrack will still make cry like a bitch even when already know the story

25882391.review:
I got it because the premise seemed interesting, but wow was I caught off guard. The voice acting is stellar, the writing is fantastic, the story is well constructed and goes from light-hearted comedy to dark and tense moments effortlessly. One (optional) part of the game in particular has you watching a character's transition from comedy to relief to a sociopath because of what were noble intentions, and it's even saddening.

The characters are unique enough that I was invested in most all of them, although there is a tsundere type of character who's EXTREMELY cliche, to the point where it feels like parody.

Learning more about each character was a pleasure and I found myself jumping into the game without question, not even looking at the other games I bought around the same time frame.

The writing and story is strong enough that you'll blow through this game like you would a stellar show and when you complete it, you'll get that knot in your stomach like you do when you finish a book or show you were REALLY invested in.

When things escalate in the story, you feel as nervous and paranoid as the main protagonist. When banter is happening, you can't help but snicker at the insults the team throws at each other.

The game has a handy Codex mode that keeps descriptions of modern Japanese internet culture to explain and give context to some of the banter, and even documents real world historical internet / computer events referenced in dialogue, like Y2K and the John Titor posts. 

The music is overall pretty good. One theme I found to be rather annoying, but when I watched the anime of this game immediately after beating it that same song popped up as a ringtone as a nod to the game, and I felt a wave of nostalgia. For a game I had JUST beaten. The main theme captures the idea of the game. Weird, sad, and scientific.

The main character is a Don Quixote type, but instead of believing himself to be a Knight of old, he considers himself to be a mad scientist bent on bringing the world to its knees. At first it comes off as strange, but it grows on you and the game uses it to portray his mental state. He often feigns the act when his friends notice that he's suddenly not spouting monologues to keep them thinking that he's okay, which was a little heart wrenching. And when you find out WHY he puts on an act at all, it pulls your heartstrings a bit.

You have a ditzy childhood friend, a nerdy, overweight hacker dude (who was a lot of the comedy relief surprisingly), a tsundere scientist, a girl who seems to know a lot and has been through tough times, a girl ...or guy? who works at a shrine, and a woman who communicates through text.

When things kick off, they REALLY kick off, and I found myself staying up extremely late to finish the story.

The twists are well done. Mostly unexpected.

There are six endings which are handily tracked by the game.

Man, this game makes you think and makes you feel. It starts off by shoving the Quixote persona down your throat and spouting science at you, but once you settle in you feel like you're part of a show.

And there is an anime based on this game! 

I got more time out of this game than I did, say, I am Setsuna, and I even found all of the secret weapons in that, and I haven't even gotten all of the endings.

If you want a time kill and want to get invested, I highly recommend. There's nothing particularly engaging about the gameplay (most of it is done through the in game phone) as it is a visual novel, but it is a very good one. I can see myself revisiting just for the story.

25866267.review:
玩了差不多二十多个小时（离线在线都加起来），觉得这个游戏有两把刷子，很值得试一试，但我不会大力推荐这款游戏因为这款游戏的实在题材是在大同小异，每个这类游戏都述说震撼人心的故事，都很精彩，大力推荐只恐怕得罪其他类似题材的老司机，但总的来说我对这款游戏很有好感。
这次评价我想来说一说几个人物，因为只玩了二十多个小时，真结局还有没打出来，而且看的又是一堆英文（虽然大部分都可以看得懂但是把上下剧情连起来我感觉有点勉强），觉得还没有资格去评论内容，如果有幸成为老司机的话也许会在补上评论。
首先评论下Urbalashi Lokako。我觉得这家伙性格实在太内向了，实在不适合与人交流，而且我感觉他非常缺乏存在感，以至于当时主角帮他接触困境时他就直接fell in love with him.....WHAT THE HELL?!而且有点傻.....我一直想不通为什么他就能听从主角的怂恿驱赶出一系列奇怪的事情来（比如第一章的驱魔）。不过同时他也是一位非常善良单纯的人物，在得知Mayuri的死于自己有关的时候（选择STARDUST SKY结局）他会牺牲自己的爱慕去换取最好的朋友的幸存，或者（选择LINK OF CORRUPTION AND REBIRTH结局）一起与主角承担这份罪孽生活下去。作为短发控说实话从长相来看的话我认为这款游戏长相最实力的就是LOKAKO了！她向主角表白的时候那三张图我TMD久久不能忘记......
再来说说Shiina Mayuri.我说句实话我最不能面对的就是这类长得比较可爱而且声优又天作之合的角色，再加上她有着如她的结局STARDUST SKY一般的心灵，我感觉我污浊的内心受到了批判。每一次Mayuri和主角有单独对话的时候，特别是到了后面的那几章节，我特别受不了差点泪崩，仔细想想，我认为我的不能接受就是觉得她的单纯给我带来的心灵谴责，同时也反映出我也期望有这么一个朋友，或者真实世界里能有这么一个人存在，然而我很清楚这是妄想罢了，也因为如此我特别受不了。Mayuri我认为与主角才是正配，她与主角一同长大，她知道怎么与主角交流，明了主角的内心在想什么，而且设身处地的为主角着想，很努力的想为主角排忧解难，这么多年来她没有因为主角的疯狂而失去原来的颜色，一直陪伴在主角的身边支持者主角的疯狂。也许她早就喜欢上了主角，只是她的内心纯洁到不知道恋爱是个什么东西，又也许是她太含蓄以至于不能说出口（我不知道主角与其他角色在一起的结局Mayuri心里怎么想的....）。这个角色最大的优点我认为就是天真与贴心，最大的缺点也是天真与贴心，之所以我认为这样是因为她这样的性格是主角能够走过这么多的坎坷，但是到了后面在某种程度上又成了阻碍主角前进的绊脚石。她不想成为主角的包袱、一直想为主角做点什么贡献，她认为自己除了为主角挡下车祸什么也没有做，但是我认为她一直都爱奉献啊，奉献自己温热的心来照亮主角坎坷的道路，这样的角色实在是正能量满格！
然后想来说说Amane Suzuha.我觉得这个角色是个悲剧的象征，她尽自己的一切去力挽狂澜回到1975年，却只能在仅三张纸的日记中写下这么多的失败；她孤身一人从未来世界穿越到2010年，但是这个时代的人类的丰富感情却是她羡慕甚至嫉妒的对象；他是一个女孩，却要独自对抗着拥有浩瀚力量的流动不息的时间，我认为这一切的一切实在是不可想象的。但是同时我又认为她非常的勇敢，虽然她的时间跳跃机器只能后退不能前进，她也要冒着走错一步便是死而且只有微小概率能够成功的险，若是我的话我就会选择逆来顺受，因为我实在没有胆量挑战时间，没有胆量去做没有退路的事情，我缺少一种勇气和自信，但就是因为如此我更加敬佩她的精神，感觉到了一种“人生自古谁无死，留取丹心照汗青”的豪迈，这份豪迈与他弱小的力量对抗着浩瀚的时间。
再来说说冈部伦太郎（这个我认得中文~）.这家伙拥有着传统日本动漫里的中二角色的全部特点，狂妄自大、说话不中听，但就总是踩到狗屎运，情商时高时低，危难关头会发出发出强烈的雄性荷尔蒙诱拐女性角色，总能拥有一大堆后宫.......（So many of it）他自称疯狂的天才科学家，与本来就不存在的黑恶势力做着顽强的斗争，想要开发出惊天地泣鬼神的发明来，但很长一段时间按就没有成功过，但他仍然认为是时机未到，也曾经受到很多人的嘲讽，但是他从来没有气馁过反而以更加狂热的姿态去迎接暴风雨，是典型的中二型拼命三郎，同时又是一位大善良的大哥哥的形象。说实话我不怎么欣赏这里角色，但是偏偏他又是主角，不评论一番感觉过不去，但想要评论什么东西出来，又觉得大家都懂了我早说都是废话，于是，主角止笔.
其他的几个角色，比如Hashida Itaru、Makise Kurisu、Faris NyanNyan(???)、Kiryu Moeka,除了助手以外我认为都没什么好说的，但偏偏助手又不是我喜欢的类型（太精英、太傲娇），于是就不做文章啦~

3.เหมือนเกมจีบสาว ผสม ไปด้วย
4.สะท้อนถึงปัญหาที่หลายคนจะเจอ ถ้าเรามองเนื้อหาลึกลงไปจะรับรู้ได้ถึง โทนดาร์คของเกม
5.ถ้าอินไปกับเกม จะสามารถทำให้เราหดหู่ ไปถึงน้ำตาคลอได้เลยทีเดียว (หรือผมบ่อน้ำตาตื่นไป)
6.ราคาไม่สูงเวอร์ แต่เหนือหาเยอะ (ถ้าไม่สคิปแต่เล่นแล้วแปลไปเรื่อยๆ)

ข้อเสีย

ข้อเสียมีแค่นี้แหละครับ ผมเป็นแฟนอวย ฮะๆๆๆ

ข้อที่ไม่ควรทำเกี่ยวกับการเล่นเกมนี้
1. เอะอะ ก็สคิป แต่มันห้ามยากครับ เพราะคนส่วนใหญ่ที่เล่นแนว VN จะชอบสคิปไปเรื่อยๆ
2.อย่าขี้เกียจที่จะอ่านเนื้อเรื่องครับ  เพราะถ้าเราไม่อ่านเนื้อหาของเกม เกมนี้จะเหมือนเสียตังฟรีเลยทีเดียว

ข้อแนะนำ

25719488.review:
‘’ I am the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma!’’ This is one of the most common things you will hear in STEINS GATE. Steins is a game developed by MAGES. INC. and is essentially a visual novel. The game was released in 2009 but it just appeared in 2016 on Steam.  Before this VN, I have never heard of STEINS GATE before which made it quite a surprise to review it thanks to its nature and the fact it is a 
sci -fi game.

From the very beginning, the game starts without any introduction. On the other hand, if you leave your game for about two minutes at the main menu, you will have a mesmerizing trailer that presents the main characters involved in the game. The trailer itself has amazing music, great imagery and gets you excited to play the VN. 

One of the unique features STEINS GATE has is the cellphone. Through the game, the player will receive many messages from different people either informing him of specific details or random banter. During some of those moments, the player can click and reply back to the characters and usually get more details on his friends. The cellphone is also a catalyst later in-game which will weave the path leading you to different endings depending on some choices. 

The main character of the game is Rintaro Okabe who likes to call himself ‘’Hououin Kyouma’’, the mad scientist. I personally disliked the protagonist for a big part of the game due to his eccentric act and his inability to be serious in many situations. There were times when ‘’oh my god’’ moments happen due to the oblivious state in which Okabe put himself. On the other hand, we find out later in the story why he acts that way and we start to care for him a lot more than before. 

All the characters in this visual novel have unique personalities and secrets. Each of them holds a burden which explains why they act in a particular way which in turn makes you love them all. There were moments when I hated specific characters for actions they were performing which annoyed me greatly, but the story is so good that despite my dislike for some of their actions I still persevered. Some of those characters are Kurisu Makise, aka Christina, the genius girl that never believes in time travel, Mayuri the airhead girl that loves to sign tutturu every time she has the occasion, Itaru the expert hacker of the team that loves to talk about his passion for games and 2d wives as well as many others. 

The story of the game revolves around time travel and spin out of control when the group manages to find secret information about SERN, a research company that attempts to take control over the world through time travel. STEINS GATE is one of the wackiest visual novel you will read in your life in terms of sheer detail. The game itself focuses partially on sci-fi fiction but also uses many scientific theories related to physics and neuroscience. The beginning is also extremely slow which will require determination from some players which are not as interested or hardcore in terms of sci-fi fiction. I personally was not one of those players but despite that, I loved the story created by MAGES. INC. They managed to create a unique universe and tell a beautiful and detailed fantasy. The game starts very light early on, has a couple of dark moments during some chapters while switching back to light feeling before going dark completely. At some point in the game, the main character was on the verge of losing his mind due to the inability to help his friends and always being stuck time traveling to the same moment. 
In terms of bugs, I personally did experience an issue when the game got released. I personally kept having my screen bugging at the beginning every time Mayuri’s face displayed which made it impossible to continue further. Luckily, the developer offered a solution and after downloading a specific DirectX from 2009, I was able to play. No other bugs were encountered during my play through.

Overall, despite not being hardcore in terms of sci-fiction, STEINS GATE was one of the best VNs I have ever played. At its current price, I believe it is worth every dollar and it is a must have for anyone that loves visual novels as well as the sci-fiction fans. The game deserves a 10/10.

For our popular daily giveaways and similar reviews head over to http://www.steamified.com/

To begin your journey through our myriad of social media join our Steam Group

25650294.review: This is my first review so bear with me here. I felt compelled to review this product because if you are reading this, I want you to experience this story. I apologize if this opinion offends anyone but I do not feel that this product is really a game.  I know the discussion has been had ad nausem about what truly makes a game. I make this distinction purely so you, the prospective buyer knows full well what he/she is purchasing. This is a novel. Theres some pick your adventure aspects but the choices are too random to be truly considered choices at all. With that being said, this novel is simply brilliant. If you love science fiction and have any interest in time travel at all you simply must read this novel. In my 50 years on this planet I have read a staggering amount of science fiction and fantasy literature and no story I've read effected me emotionally as much as this story did. And not just once. Time and time again this story delivers an emotional punch that will linger will you long after you've concluded all the various endings. This work is a bargain at twice whatever price its currently being offered at.

25645966.review: GALGAMEじゃない、これは人生だ。

25644979.review:
Well, this is the first time I bought galgame, or maybe, text-based adventure type of game, or maybe, Japanese style game of time and space concept.
算是第一次买gal类，或者文字冒险类，或者日式时空观类游戏吧。
Actually I learned some Japanese and I played the Japanese version. And I had known this game by watching the Anime version.
实际上我学了些日语然后玩了日文版。游戏是通过アニメ了解到的。
I played for about 4.5 hours. This is my conclusion.
玩了4.5小时，怎么评价好呢。

For first, it does not suit me.
首先，它不适合我。
It does not suit me while its story paces really slowly and although it sets a very nice and rather logically rigorous theory of time or time line(世界線), (don't bother. I know it is not truth. At least it gives me a feel that this story makes few conflicts.)it still reveals as a galgame. I have to deal with what I dislike about otaku culture, the girls, whoever just wants to impress the main and tyuunibyou(中二病) character.
它不适合我，因为故事节奏太慢，即使时间观和世界线理论相对严谨（我知道不是真实，但起码它很少自相矛盾），它仍然只能作为galgame面世。并且因此我必须面对为我所不太齿的御宅文化中的东西---那些女孩子，都想让中二男主印象深刻。

And for second, it is a good story, ignoring the girls.
第二，如果无视上述女孩子的行为，这算是好游戏。
That this kind of game is the visual novel type of thing is and should be understood as the precondition.
这类游戏是视觉小说，是也应该是被理解为先决条件的。
That this kind of visual novel is unavoidably that girls are always around is and should be understood as the second precondition.
这类视觉小说不可避免地女孩围在周围，是也应该是被理解为第二先决条件的。
I traveled around and around, trying to save what I love and cherish (Mayuri the girl), I found troubles and I went on, and I finally decided to love with someone that I chose.
我一次又一次地探险，尝试拯救我所珍爱（真由理），我遇到障碍并继续前行，并最终选择我爱的人。
Based on such line, Okabe the protagonist tells the whole story.
基本如上，主角冈部讲完了这个故事。
The protagonist himself behaves based on the options of the player, which decides the following story. And this story creates a nice concept on time stuff. The player will find out the truth while playing and alternates by his wish (although not completely). And this story is well fitted with details on some kind of behaviors.
主角自身按照玩家意愿决定后续故事，而且这个故事弄了很棒的时空观。玩家将在玩的过程中发现真相并以自己意愿去替换原有时间线之物（虽然不是彻底任意地）。这个故事在细节行为上做得很棒。

But thirdly, too many girls.
I don't like the feel being chosen as the character and I have girls around as options in my harem. That kind of feel is not bad if you want your pleasure based simply and only on your balls. That kind of feel is bad when you are going to save the world and when you want to save it, you have to date with them. Oh, saving the world while dating with girls? I am out of the story. Like gigguk said, my bones are gone. The only exception when the character jerks and I remain watching seriously is EVA :D (And shut up Shinji).
但是我不喜欢被选为主角之后不得不面对貌似是后宫里的女孩。这种感觉单纯意淫一下还不错，但是这感觉混搭在你拯救世界的时候就糟透了。听说我要和女孩子约会来拯救世界？不好意思我出戏了。就像gigguk所说，感觉就像痿了。  除非你想说主角打飞机你还能认真体验剧情。

So...
Is it a good game? Yes, with 1080p HD video, your experience will be good.
Only if you like this kind of game.
所以说，
它是个好游戏吗？是，有着1080p高清动画，你会有不错的体验。
前提是你喜欢这一类型。

For me I recommend the anime version. It is good for me to feel less compelled to deal with girls' romantic troubles that is set on a time concept by myself.  
给我的话我更推荐动画版。不必感觉自己是在时间概念下强面女孩子的感觉对我来说不错。

PS：
I hate nya-nya and do-do-ru (I don't really know how to type that in kana, because that's not tradional pronounciation for Japanese). If that's how the writer describes a role, I just feel it makes me embarrassed. Mayuri IS A 16 YEAR OLD GIRL!!!
另外我超烦nyanya和嘟嘟噜（由于日语里正常是没有嘟音的所以不知道怎么打假名）。如果那是作者的角色塑造，我会觉得很尴尬。真由理16岁了！！！
